name: v0.9.0
body:
Support for the legacy ID format has been removed in version `v0.9.0`. The provider has defaulted to the new format since version `v0.7.0`. If you have been using the legacy format with the `legacy_id_format = true` backwards compatibility until now, make sure to [migrate IDs before upgrading to `v0.9.0`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/kbst/kustomization/latest/docs#migrating-resource-ids-from-legacy-format-to-format-enabling-api-version-upgrades).

## What's Changed
* Remove legacy id support by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/187
* Refactor k8s resource handling, separate from resource functions by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/188
* Update dependency versions by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/189
* Revert including file name and line in logs lines by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/190
* Add server side dry-run before create fix #24 by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/191
* Lower default timeouts and allow to customize with timeouts block by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/192
* Refactor logError and km.fmtErr to avoid duplicate output by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/193
* Error when namespace set but not allowed or not set when required by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/196
* Document legacy ID not supported after 0.9.0 by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/197
* Handle storage class immutable fields with force new plan fix #194 by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/199


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/compare/v0.8.2...v0.9.0

name: v0.8.2
body:
## What's Changed
* Update docs to show sensitive() and convenience module fix #150 by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/181
* Fix secret type nil bug and add test case #182 by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/183


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/compare/v0.8.1...v0.8.2

name: v0.8.1
body:
## What's Changed
* Use tag as test module ref by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/168
* Wait until service account exists for SA token secrets by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/172
* Add integration test for state migration by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/173
* Start upgrade test from 0.7.2 to test upstream fix by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/175
* Allow adding labels without also automatically injecting corresponding selectors by @gregorycuellar in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/177
* Handle roleRef changes with destroy and recreate plan fix #176 by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/179

## New Contributors
* @gregorycuellar made their first contribution in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/177

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/compare/v0.8.0...v0.8.1

name: v0.8.0
body:
## What's Changed
* Upgrade to Terraform Provider SDK v2 by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/107
* Compress lastAppliedConfig if metadata.annotations is too long by @pst in https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/pull/165

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kbst/terraform-provider-kustomization/compare/v0.7.2...v0.8.0

## Usage notes

1. The SDK v2 upgrade required a change to the schema of the `kustomization_overlay` resource. To adapt, change your patches `target` to a block.

   For catalog modules, the following versions have a `>= 0.8.0` version constraint:
   * [argo-cd-v2.3.3-kbst.1](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/argo-cd-v2.3.3-kbst.1)
   * [cert-manager-v1.7.2-kbst.1](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/cert-manager-v1.7.2-kbst.1)
   * [custom-manifests-v0.3.0](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/custom-manifests-v0.3.0)
   * [flux-v1.25.0-kbst.1](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/flux-v1.25.0-kbst.1)
   * [nginx-v1.1.3-kbst.1](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/nginx-v1.1.3-kbst.1)
   * [opa-gatekeeper-v3.7.1-kbst.2](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/opa-gatekeeper-v3.7.1-kbst.2)
   * [postgresql-v1.7.1-kbst.2](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/postgresql-v1.7.1-kbst.2)
   * [prometheus-v0.55.1-kbst.0](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/prometheus-v0.55.1-kbst.0)
   * [sealed-secrets-v0.17.4-kbst.1](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/sealed-secrets-v0.17.4-kbst.1)
   * [tektoncd-v0.34.1-kbst.1](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/tektoncd-v0.34.1-kbst.1)

   Also, the custom manifests module has a new release with the respective version constraint:
   * [custom-manifests-v0.3.0](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/custom-manifests-v0.3.0)

3. To support big CRDs, like the Prometheus operator CRD the provider now supports storing the lastAppliedConfig annotation compressed. It will do this automatically, for all resources that are too big. All other resources are left untouched. If you want to disable compression entirely, set `gzip_last_applied_config = false` on the provider.
   
   With this feature, the Prometheus module could finally be updated:
   * [prometheus-v0.55.1-kbst.0](https://github.com/kbst/catalog/tree/prometheus-v0.55.1-kbst.0)

name: v0.7.0
body:
## Changelog

 * Switch to new ID format as the default and enable in-place apiVersion upgrades #130 - thanks @willthames 
 * Improve error message when API group/kind is missing #144 - thanks @willthames 
 * Add patch options to support `allow_kind_change` and `allow_name_change` #146 - thanks @willthames

name: v0.6.0
body:
## Changelog

 * Replace homegrown caching RESTMapper with upstream implementation #105 
 * Add documentation for load-restrictor #120 - thanks @willthames 
 * Add in-cluster provider configuration option #122 - thanks @willthames 
 * Refactor resource IDs to not include apiVersion #128 - thanks @willthames 
 * ForceNew when name or namespace change without state ID change #133
 * Update Kustomize dependency versions #134 - thanks @willthames 
 
### Upcoming ID format change

Note about the ID format change. This release includes a new ID format. For now, the legacy format is still used by default. But a future release will migrate to the new format as the default. The new format has the benefit, that it does not include the `apiVersion` in the ID anymore, enabling the provider to handle `apiVersion` updates to Kubernetes resources as in-place updates. With the legacy format an `apiVersion` change would result in a destroy-and-recreate plan. Refer to #93 for more details.

To use the new format already now, set `legacy_id_format = false` in the provider. To enforce keeping the legacy format, set `legacy_id_format = true` explicitly. This is currently also the default.

name: v0.5.0
body:
## Changelog

 * Exactly one of `kubeconfig_path` or `kubeconfig_raw` is now required #103 
   Users need to update their configurations when upgrading to v0.5.0 or later. For convenience, `kubeconfig_path` can be set using the `KUBECONFIG_PATH` environment variable.
 * Determine the patch type based on the GVK and send correct patch #102 
 * Add option to disable kustomize load restrictions #101 - thanks @dreddick-home

name: v0.4.3
body:
## Changelog

 * Refactor FS implementation to work on Windows #95
 * Prevent parallel Kustomize runs to workaround upstream bug #100

name: v0.4.2
body:
## Changelog

* Fall back to a `MergePatch` in case of an invalid `StrategicMergePatch` #87 
* Handle immutable `SatatefulSet` fields by creating a destroy and re-create plan #88 
* Explicitly refuse to import resources without a `LastAppliedConfigAnnotation` #89

name: v0.4.1
body:
## Changelog

* Allow multiple `kustomization_overlay` data sources in the same root module #83

name: v0.4.0
body:
## Changelog

* Add `kustomization_overlay` data source, allowing customizing resources using values from Terraform #76 
* Add `ids_prio`, allowing to set explicit depends_on for resources #80

name: v0.3.0
body:
This provider release mainly updates Kustomize to add support for the latest features, especially `components`. Other dependencies have also been updated, but do not introduce functional changes. Version was bumped to `v0.3.0` to reflect the inclusion of new Kustomize features.

## Changelog

name: v0.2.0-beta.0
body:
* Support for specifying the KUBECONFIG context #28 
 * Use `strategic-merge-patch` instead of `merge-patch` as patch strategy in line with `kubectl` #29 
 * Cache the list of API resources to reduce the amount of requests we make against the K8s API #33 
 * Control order of resources to avoid edge cases when applying larger Kustomize bases #39

name: v0.1.2-beta.0
body: Fixes an upstream regression regarding commonLabels by upgrading kustomize/api to v0.4.1.

name: v0.1.1-beta.0
body: Updated Kustomize and Kubernetes client-go dependencies.

name: v0.1.0-beta.3
body:
Improved resiliency during create:
 * wait for CRDs to exist when creating a custom object
 * wait for namespaces to exist when creating a namespaced object

Improved resiliency during delete:
 * after a cascading delete of a namespace, don't fail on not found for resources to be deleted

name: v0.1.0-beta.2
body: Improved error output for errors the provider returns to Terraform.

name: v0.1.0-beta.1
body: Fix hardcoded GroupVersionResource helper method by correctly determining the resource for a GroupVersionKind from the API server.

name: v0.1.0-beta.0
body:
First release including:
 * `kustomization` data source for kustomize builds
 * `kustomization_resource` using k8s client-go dynamic to support any k8s kind
 * includes individual k8s resource into Terraform lifecycle including k8s server side dry runs
 * state import to migrate resources previously applied using kubectl
 * provider config using either kubeconfig_path or kubeconfig_raw

To use, follow the build instructions or download below binary (linux-amd64 only) and place it as `terraform.d/plugins/linux_amd64/terraform-provider-kustomization` in your root module.
